005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.impl.DefaultUniqueConstraint;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * Represents a rule that requires all matching data items found in a Metaschema
015 * data instance to have a unique key.
016 * <p>
017 * This rule is similar to the {@link IIndexConstraint} in how the keys are
018 * generated, but this constraint type does not persist a named index.
019 */
020public interface IUniqueConstraint extends IKeyConstraint {
021
022  @Override
023  default <T, R> R accept(IConstraintVisitor<T, R> visitor, T state) {
024    return visitor.visitUniqueConstraint(this, state);
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Create a new constraint builder.
029   *
030   * @return the builder
031   */
032  @NonNull
033  static Builder builder() {
034    return new Builder();
035  }
036
037  /**
038   * Provides a builder pattern for constructing a new {@link IUniqueConstraint}.
039   */
040  final class Builder
041      extends AbstractKeyConstraintBuilder<Builder, IUniqueConstraint> {
042    private Builder() {
043      // disable construction
044    }
045
046    @Override
047    protected Builder getThis() {
048      return this;
049    }
050
051    @Override
052    protected IUniqueConstraint newInstance() {
053      return new DefaultUniqueConstraint(
054          getId(),
055          getFormalName(),
056          getDescription(),
057          ObjectUtils.notNull(getSource()),
058          getLevel(),
059          getTarget(),
060          getProperties(),
061          getKeyFields(),
062          getMessage(),
063          getRemarks());
064    }
065  }
066}
